JobFullDesc: Telco Open Ecosystem Engineering Our Software Systems Engineering team ensures that our customers have the software systems they need for a changing world. Working at the cutting edge, we design and deliver software systems modifications as well as enhancements of new products. We oversee product development at all stages: planning, designing, developing and testing operating systems, compilers, routers, utilities, databases, embedded management and control devices, plus internet-related tools.We are looking for talented, driven, self-starter individuals to join our Telco Systems business unit engineering team. This role requires a demonstrated ability to conduct code development, test, and delivery for Dell’s telco products and solutions offerings.About business unit and teamThe Telco Systems BU creates products and solutions catering to the worldwide telecommunications market, which is exploding with new and exciting opportunities offered by new developments such as 5G, Internet of Things, and virtualized radio access networks (RANs). The market consists of communication service providers, managed service providers, hosting companies, content delivery network companies, cloud service providers, and consumer/enterprise web-technology providersThe ecosystem solution engineering team is responsible for partnering, creating and delivering telco solutions with ecosystem partners for telco customers. The team works closely with a world-class product and partner management team in defining and roadmapping the offerings. Together, we have a strong track record of creating unique value for Dell Technologies, with a robust and positive impact on its bottom line. The engineering team works closely with key service provider customers worldwide, which, taken together, represent about 70% of the market. Collaboratively, we create production-worthy offerings that are unique, cutting-edge, and shape this emerging market. With each success we achieve, we push the envelope more for our customers and then rinse and repeat!Please apply for this position if this excites you! The ideal candidate has telco network experience with vital technical training, impeccable industrial pedigree, a strong record of innovation, and is looking for their next more significant challenge. The individual is not afraid to tinker with the system to build multi-layered disaggregated solutions. They have to be self-learner, be an excellent communicator, and above all, be efficient in all that they do. The individual will work with geographically dispersed teams, so experience operating in such intercontinental environments will be a huge plus.Role and ResponsibilitiesAssess current tools, technology, and processes within the organization and develop a process and solution framework to test and offer solutions to the marketplace continuously. Develop and document best practices based on your learnings with actual customer integration.Work with extended teams; project management, product management, partners, services, and other BUs to drive integration and adoption of Dell product within partner ecosystem and create a better application integrationManage technical relationships between Dell TSB engineering team and application partner to drive any co-engineering, co-validation, and co-innovation initiatives between Dell TSB and the partner.Be the change agent by advocating for features needed for joint customers and the removal of technical roadblocks. The result is a rich product roadmap with the customer with partner-relevant prioritization.Mentor and educate others throughout the Dell and partner ecosystem. Always seek to improve processes companywide continuallyEssential Knowledge/SkillsExtensive experience with CI/CD and build automation tooling (Chef, Terraform, Ansible, etc.), including assessing toolset, process definition, architecting new framework and bring them up in a production environment.Extensive background in architecture, implementation, and delivery of Telco solutions to marketExperience of development including vIMS, vEPC, RAN, OpenRAN/O-RAN, LTE/4G and 5G deployments, OSS/BSS, platform models such as NFV and distributed/federated edge platforms (e.g. ETSI MEC)Advanced understanding of system performance and scaling, debugging, diagnosing, and troubleshooting software. Agile software development experience enables shorter development iterations, fast feedback loops, and problem-free code deployment.Strong communication skills and an ability to articulate technical vision while understanding business requirements. Able to present and get buy-in from network architect as well as CTOEducation: Bachelor’s or Master’s in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or equivalent. Experience:12+ years (Bachelor’s degree), 8+years (Master’s degree) of software development, software architecture, Telco scale solution and performance testing or equivalent experience.Desired Knowledge/SkillsFamiliar with Data Protection, Networking, and Compute Technologies, including software-defined aspects.Proven experience in selecting and deploying appropriate CI/CD tools. Monitoring and measuring customer experience and KPIs. Identifying and deploying qualification measure like cybersecurity by continuously performing vulnerability assessment and risk managementFamiliar with Virtualization, Big Data and Analytics, Machine Learning, and AI Platforms. Familiar with Hyperscaler technologies such as AWS, Azure, and Google.Experience collaborating with customers to understand the problem statement/use cases and mapping them to tangible technical requirements."TELCOBU"Dell Technologies helps organizations and individuals build a brighter digital tomorrow. Our company is made up of more than 150,000 people, located in over 180 locations around the world. We’re proud to be a diverse and inclusive team and have an endless passion for our mission to drive human progress.What’s most important to us is that you are respected, feel like you can be yourself and have the opportunity to do the best work of your life -- while still having a life. We offer excellent benefits, bonus programs, flexible work arrangements, a variety of career development opportunities, employee resource groups, and much more.We started with computers, but we didn’t stop there. We are helping customers move into the future with multi-cloud, AI and machine learning through the most innovative technology and services portfolio for the data era. Join us and become a part of what’s next in technology, starting today.You can also learn more about us by reading our latest Diversity and Inclusion Report and our plan to make the world a better place by 2030 here.Dell is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at Dell are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, national, social or ethnic origin, sex (including pregnancy), age, physical, mental or sensory disability, HIV Status, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital, civil union or domestic partnership status, past or present military service, family medical history or genetic information, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. Dell will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics. Dell encourages applicants of all ages. Read the full Equal Employment Opportunity Policy here.
